storage-basics.name: Filecoin Storage Basics
storage-basics.description: Complete tutorial series for learning Filecoin Onchain Cloud storage fundamentals, from environment setup to production deployment

resources.name: What is Filecoin Onchain Cloud?
resources.description: 5-minute introduction to Filecoin Onchain Cloud and how it differs from traditional cloud storage

resources.name: Getting Started with Filecoin Onchain Cloud
resources.description: Get your development environment running and grab some test tokens. You'll install the Synapse SDK, fund a payment account, and figure out why Filecoin uses two different tokens instead of one.
topics: The Dual Token System (tFIL and USDFC)

resources.name: Payment Account Management
resources.description: Payment accounts work differently than regular wallets. They hold funds that operators can charge automatically for storage services. You'll learn how to deposit USDFC and set up operator approvals without getting charged for things you didn't authorize.

resources.name: Storage + Payment Flow
resources.description: 5-minute visual walkthrough of how storage and payment operations work together in Filecoin

resources.name: Your First Upload to Filecoin
resources.description: Upload a file and get back a PieceCID, which is basically a cryptographic receipt proving your data is stored on the blockchain. You'll walk through the six phases of uploading and check your storage deal on the block explorer.
topics: Production Considerations (File Size, Metadata, Error Handling)

resources.name: Understanding Verification
resources.description: 4-minute deep dive into how cryptographic verification ensures data integrity in Filecoin

resources.name: Downloading and Verifying Data
resources.description: Pull your file back down using its PieceCID and verify that every single byte matches what you originally uploaded. No trusting the provider, just pure math proving you got the right data.

resources.name: Working with Datasets
resources.description: Instead of juggling a dozen PieceCIDs, create a dataset that groups related files together. You get shared metadata, one payment rail for everything, and way less headache when you're uploading photo albums or document collections.
topics: Production Considerations (Organization, Metadata Schema, Cost Optimization)

resources.name: Advanced Payment Operations
resources.description: Move past basic deposits and start monitoring your payment account like you would in production. Check balances, track how much is locked up, see which operators can charge you, and build alerts so you don't run out of funds mid-storage.
topics: Checking Wallet and Payment Account Balances
Account Health Monitoring (Lockup, Available Funds, Days Remaining)
Production Deployment Strategies (Monitoring, Auto-Replenishment, Cost Tracking)

assignment.name: Storage Basics Module Assignment
assignment.description: Build a simple file storage app with file upload, list stored files with metadata, download on click, show PieceCIDs and sizes, and display current balance. Demonstrates the complete storage lifecycle.

fast-delivery.name: Fast Delivery with Beam CDN
fast-delivery.description: Learn how to accelerate content delivery using Filecoin Beam CDN, monitor performance metrics, and stream large media files efficiently

resources.name: Standard vs. Beam Retrieval
resources.description: 4-minute comparison of standard retrieval and Filecoin Beam, explaining the performance differences and when to use each option

resources.name: How Filecoin Beam Works
resources.description: 6-minute deep dive into the technical architecture behind Filecoin Beam's CDN-level performance and edge distribution

resources.name: Enabling Beam CDN for Fast Content Delivery
resources.description: Turn on Beam CDN with a single parameter and watch your download speeds jump. You'll compare standard retrieval against CDN-enabled delivery, understand how provider competition works, and learn when the paid-per-byte model makes sense.

resources.name: Egress Pricing & Credits
resources.description: 4-minute explanation of how egress is measured and billed on Filecoin Beam, including current pricing and credit setup

resources.name: Monitor Beam Performance
resources.description: Build an observability stack for your decentralized infrastructure. You'll create a heartbeat prober to measure TTFB and throughput, implement circuit breakers to prevent budget overruns, and launch a real-time dashboard that shows system health in under 500ms.
topics: The Visibility Paradox in Decentralized Systems
Circuit Breaker Pattern for Budget Control

resources.name: Streaming Large Files
resources.description: Break through the Memory Wall and stream gigabyte-sized videos without crashing your server. You'll use Node.js Streams to handle backpressure, build an HTTP Range Request proxy, and create a custom video player that seeks instantly without heavy frameworks.
topics: Data Gravity and Large File Ingestion
Native Browser APIs vs Heavy Frameworks

assignment.name: Fast Delivery Module Assignment
assignment.description: Build a video streaming app with file upload, stream videos using Beam CDN, show loading progress, display playback with HTML5 video player, and track egress costs per video.

multi-chain-deployment.name: Multi-Chain Deployment
multi-chain-deployment.description: Build applications that accept payments on any L2 chain while storing data on Filecoin, with quota management and NFT metadata support

resources.name: Why Cross-Chain Storage?
resources.description: 5-minute introduction explaining why every blockchain doesn't need its own storage layer and how Filecoin provides unified storage for multi-chain applications

resources.name: How Cross-Chain Storage Works
resources.description: 6-minute technical walkthrough showing how data moves from Layer 2s to Filecoin storage and how backends manage the cross-chain flow

resources.name: Setting Up Backend Storage
resources.description: Set up a backend service that handles Filecoin storage for any blockchain. Users pay on Base, Arbitrum, or Polygon, and your backend takes care of all the storage operations. No more forcing users to deal with Filecoin tokens directly.
topics: Dual Balance Checking (Wallet vs Payment Account)

resources.name: Multi-Chain App Patterns
resources.description: 4-minute overview of practical multi-chain application patterns using shared Filecoin storage across Base, Arbitrum, and Polygon

resources.name: Tracking User Payments and Quotas
resources.description: Build the accounting layer that converts L2 payments into storage quotas. Track who paid what, enforce upload limits, and make sure nobody gets more storage than they paid for. Includes database schema and quota enforcement patterns.

resources.name: Storing NFT Metadata
resources.description: Store NFT metadata on Filecoin and serve it to contracts on any chain. You'll work with ERC-721 JSON standards, build an API that returns metadata by token ID, and learn how one backend can power NFTs across Ethereum, Base, and Polygon simultaneously.
topics: Single Token and Batch Collection Uploads

assignment.name: Multi-Chain Deployment Module Assignment
assignment.description: Upload NFT metadata using filecoin-pin to generate IPFS CIDs. Deploy NFT contracts on Base, Arbitrum, and Polygon that reference the same IPFS URIs. Build gallery showing all NFTs with chain badges, click to view full metadata and verify storage proofs. Demonstrates how single IPFS-compatible storage layer serves multiple chains.
topics: Deploy NFT Contracts on Base, Arbitrum, and Polygon
Build NFT Gallery with Chain Badges
View Metadata and Verify Storage Proofs
Single Storage Layer for Multiple Chains

payment-architecture.name: Payment Architecture Patterns
payment-architecture.description: Master the three payment models for Filecoin applications: User-Pays for maximum decentralization, dApp-Pays for frictionless onboarding, and Hybrid for sustainable growth

resources.name: Payment Architecture Patterns
resources.description: 5-minute overview of different payment architecture patterns in Filecoin applications, covering who pays for storage and retrieval in each model

resources.name: Operators & Allowances Deep Dive
resources.description: 5-minute technical deep dive into how operators and allowances work in Filecoin Pay, explaining the core mechanics used across all payment models

resources.name: Implementing User-Pays Architecture
resources.description: Build applications where users control their wallets and pay for storage directly. You'll verify payment account balances, check operator approvals, and execute uploads that users fund themselves. Perfect for crypto-native apps that need censorship resistance.

resources.name: Implementing dApp-Pays Architecture
resources.description: Create Web2-like experiences where your application treasury covers all storage costs. Users authenticate with email, never see crypto, and upload files without wallets. You'll manage treasury solvency, map PieceCIDs to users, and build sustainable monetization strategies.

resources.name: Building Hybrid Payment Systems
resources.description: Combine the best of both worlds with tiered storage. Free users get treasury-sponsored storage up to quotas, power users pay directly for unlimited capacity. You'll build decision engines, implement quota systems, handle tier transitions, and create sustainable freemium models.

resources.name: Advanced Payment Rails
resources.description: 4-minute exploration of advanced payment rail patterns, including multiple payment rails, conditional payments, and sophisticated payment strategies

assignment.name: Payment Architecture Module Assignment
assignment.description: Build a Storage-as-a-Service platform implementing all three payment patterns (User-Pays, dApp-Pays, and Hybrid). Include a dashboard with payment model selector, usage tracking, cost breakdown per user, and payment rail health monitoring.

production-monitoring.name: Production Monitoring and Observability
production-monitoring.description: Build production-grade monitoring systems for Filecoin storage infrastructure. Learn to track proof submissions, analyze historical data with subgraphs, and create automated alert systems to prevent downtime

resources.name: Real-Time Proof Monitoring
resources.description: Monitor cryptographic proofs in real-time to ensure your data stays stored. You'll query smart contracts for provider status, check payment account health, understand WindowPoSt and PDP proof schedules, and build the JSON structures that power monitoring dashboards.
topics: Contract Discovery (Warm Storage, Payments, PDP Verifier)

resources.name: Historical Analysis with Subgraph
resources.description: Query Filecoin's historical data using the Synapse SDK's SubgraphService. You'll analyze provider performance over time, generate time-series data for charts, calculate cost analytics like burn rate and runway, and deploy your own subgraph indexer on Goldsky.
topics: The Data Layer Problem (Why Subgraphs Matter)
Querying Data Sets with Typed Methods

resources.name: Building an Alert System
resources.description: Build a production alert system that notifies you before disasters happen. You'll define alert rules with severity levels, send real webhook notifications to Discord or Slack, configure email alerts, implement SLA monitoring, and prevent alert fatigue through deduplication.

assignment.name: Production Monitoring Module Assignment
assignment.description: Build a comprehensive Storage Operations Dashboard combining real-time monitoring, historical analysis, and automated alerts. Include status panels showing contract addresses and network info, balance widgets with health indicators, provider reliability charts, cost analytics, proof submission timelines, active alerts with severity levels, and SLA compliance reports.

trustless-agent-infrastructure.name: Trustless Agent Infrastructure
trustless-agent-infrastructure.description: Build autonomous agent infrastructure on Filecoin. Create verifiable agent identities using the ERC-8004 standard, build append-only memory systems with Data Sets, and implement autonomous payment management that keeps agents operational without human intervention.

resources.name: Agent Storage Problem & Solution
resources.description: Understand the critical role of storage in autonomous agent infrastructure. Learn why agents need persistent, verifiable memory and identity to operate independently.

resources.name: Store Agent Cards with Proofs
resources.description: Learn how to create and store agent identities on Filecoin using the ERC-8004 standard. Understand the importance of cryptographic proofs for establishing trustless agent identity.

resources.name: Create and Store an Agent Card
resources.description: Build a verifiable agent identity on Filecoin. Construct an ERC-8004 Agent Card with capabilities and endpoints, upload it using the Synapse SDK, verify byte-for-byte integrity, simulate on-chain registration, and confirm proof requirements protect the stored identity.
topics: Synapse SDK Upload with Piece Metadata
Proof of Data Possession for Identity
Hot Wallet Security for Agent Keys

resources.name: Agent Memory & Data Sets
resources.description: Discover how to build tamper-evident memory systems for agents using Filecoin Data Sets. Learn to construct append-only logs that provide a verifiable history of agent decisions.

resources.name: Build Agent Memory System
resources.description: Create an append-only, tamper-evident memory system for autonomous agents. Use Filecoin Data Sets to store structured decision logs, observations, and error records. Each entry receives its own PieceCID, forming an immutable audit trail that anyone can verify.
topics: Filecoin Data Sets as Memory Banks

resources.name: Payment Setup for Agents
resources.description: Build autonomous payment management for Filecoin agents. Monitor gas balance, USDFC distribution, and payment account health. Implement conditional top-up logic, auto-fix operator approvals, track payment rails, and build a comprehensive health dashboard.
topics: Three-Layer Financial Model (FIL Gas, Wallet USDFC, Payment Account)
Wallet vs Payment Account USDFC Distribution
Payment Account Details (Funds, Lockup, Available, Rate)
Days Remaining Calculation from Lockup Rate

capstone.name: Trustless Agent Infrastructure Capstone
capstone.description: Build a complete autonomous agent that combines all three capabilities: a verifiable identity card stored on Filecoin, an append-only memory system recording all decisions, and self-managing payment infrastructure. The agent should run on a schedule, monitor its own health, and operate without human intervention.
